Sentencas: Incorporating solar energy technologies into integrated energy systems (IES) plays an increasingly important role to mitigate energy supply shortages and climate challenges.
Titulo: Optimal design and performance assessment for a solar powered electricity, heating and hydrogen integrated energy system

Sentencas: However, the low efficiency of solar energy utilization and land limitation for system deployment greatly restrict the development of the solar powered IESs.
Titulo: Optimal design and performance assessment for a solar powered electricity, heating and hydrogen integrated energy system

Sentencas: In this paper, a solar powered electricity, heating and hydrogen IES based on photovoltaic (PV), photothermal (PT) and photocatalysis of hydrogen production (PH) is proposed and investigated.
Titulo: Optimal design and performance assessment for a solar powered electricity, heating and hydrogen integrated energy system

Sentencas: The system comprises solar radiation spectrum splitting technology, PV, PT, PH, electric heating device, compressive heat pump, solid oxide fuel cell, absorption heat pump and energy storage components.
Titulo: Optimal design and performance assessment for a solar powered electricity, heating and hydrogen integrated energy system

Sentencas: A component sizing method based on a region contraction algorithm is employed to find the system optimal design with minimizing the cost of energy.
Titulo: Optimal design and performance assessment for a solar powered electricity, heating and hydrogen integrated energy system

Sentencas: Two scenarios of the solar powered IES based on solar spectrum splitting unit and independent energy supply unit are analyzed and compared.
Titulo: Optimal design and performance assessment for a solar powered electricity, heating and hydrogen integrated energy system

Sentencas: The results show that the solar powered IES can completely meet the electricity, heating and hydrogen energy demands and achieve cost savings for consumers.
Titulo: Optimal design and performance assessment for a solar powered electricity, heating and hydrogen integrated energy system

Sentencas: Compared to independent energy supply unit-based IES, the use of solar spectrum splitting unit can significantly improve the total energy efficiency by 21.74% and reduce the land area for solar capture by 52.5%, but increase the cost of energy by 27.3%.
Titulo: Optimal design and performance assessment for a solar powered electricity, heating and hydrogen integrated energy system
